title: GpuRaySensor does not update time stamps if the scene is static

content.raw:
I tested some mapping stuff with a simulated quadrotor in Gazebo 1.9.1 coming with ROS hydro today. I am using a GPU ray sensor and the `libgazebo_ros_gpu_laser.so` plugin from gazebo_ros_pkgs.

When I switched the robot model to be static (for testing purposes, using the `<static>true</static>` tag in its description), I still got laser scans in ROS and also on gazebo's scan topic, but the time stamps have not been updated. If I changed the scene (e.g. by adding a block via the GUI), the time stamp was updated once but then remained fixed again.

The ROS plugin just takes the stamp from gazebo's `LaserScanStamped` message, so it's the GpuRaySensor that generates the wrong stamp. The RaySensor works fine even in a static scene.
